content.text:
Done. Here's what changed:

**MessageBubble.tsx:**
- Thinking segments now render as `<details>` elements (collapsed by default)
- The summary shows "Thinking" label + a preview of the first line (truncated to 80 chars)
- While actively streaming, the thinking segment stays `open` so you can watch it in real-time
- Once streaming completes, thinking segments collapse, showing just the preview text
- Answer segments remain unchanged (always visible)

**MessageBubble.css:**
- Added styles for the collapsible: disclosure triangle (`▶`/`▼`), preview text that hides when expanded, smooth rotation transition

message.content: make all thinking steps into one collapse, default state: collapsed, but it should show currently thinking text in the title of collapse

content.thinking: The user wants all thinking segments merged into a single collapsible section, not individual collapsibles per thinking segment. Let me re-read the current state of the file and redesign.

content.text: Now I'll rewrite the component to collect all thinking segments into one collapsible block, with tool/answer segments rendered outside of it.

content.content: The file /home/cyyeh/repos/ts-projects/duckdb-web/src/components/MessageBubble.tsx has been updated successfully.

lines: -function SegmentView({ segment, isStreaming }: { segment: ContentSegment; isStreaming?: boolean }) {
+function ThinkingBlock({ segments, streamingRemainder }: { segments: ContentSegment[]; streamingRemainder?: string }) {
+  // Check if currently in a thinking-only phase (no answer segment yet)
-            <SegmentView key={i} segment={seg} isStreaming={message.isStreaming && i === message.segments!.length - 1 && seg.type === 'thinking'} />
-            // Show text that's being streamed but not yet in a segment

content.text: The CSS is already in good shape from the previous change. Let me verify it's all consistent.

CSS looks good. Here's what changed:

**All thinking steps are now merged into one collapsible block:**

- `ThinkingBlock` component collects all thinking segments' text and joins them into a single `<details>` element
- **Default state: collapsed** — shows the last line of thinking text as a preview in the summary title
- **While actively streaming** (thinking phase, before answer): opens automatically so you can watch thinking in real-time, with the preview showing the latest thinking text
- **Once an answer starts or streaming ends**: collapses back, showing the last thinking line as the title
- Tool results and answer segments render separately below the single thinking block

message.content: sql query and result along the thinking steps should also under the thinkingblock

content.thinking: The user wants tool segments (SQL query results) to also be included inside the single ThinkingBlock collapsible, not rendered separately outside it. Let me update the component.

content.text: I need to restructure `ThinkingBlock` to include all non-answer segments (thinking + tool) in order, rendered inside the single collapsible.

export function MessageBubble({ message }: { message: ChatMessage }) {
// Check if currently in a thinking-only phase (no answer segment yet)

content.text:
Done. Now all thinking text segments **and** SQL query/result tool segments are grouped inside a single collapsible `<details>` block:

- **Collapsed by default** — shows the last thinking line as the preview title
- **While streaming** (before answer appears) — opens automatically, preview updates with latest thinking text
- **Once answer starts** — collapses, all thinking + tool results hidden behind one toggle
- **Answer segments** render outside the collapsible, always visible

file.content:
# DuckDB SQL Playground

A browser-based SQL playground powered by [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm). Upload CSV files and query them with SQL — everything runs entirely in your browser with no server required.

**Live site:** https://cyyeh.github.io/duckdb-web/

## Features

- **In-browser SQL engine** — DuckDB compiled to WebAssembly, no server required
- **CSV file upload** — Drag-and-drop or click to import CSV files (up to 500 MB) with automatic schema detection
- **Sample dataset** — One-click load of the Titanic dataset to get started quickly
- **SQL query editor** — Write and execute queries with Ctrl+Enter
- **Results table** — View query results with column names, row counts, and execution time
- **Collapsible table sidebar** — Browse uploaded tables, inspect columns and types, toggle to expand your workspace

## Getting Started

```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

Open http://localhost:5173 to use the playground.

## Build

```bash
npm run build
npm run preview
```

## Deployment

The project includes a GitHub Actions workflow that automatically deploys to GitHub Pages on push to `main`.

## Tech Stack

- [React](https://react.dev/) 18
- [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
- [Vite](https://vite.dev/)
- [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm)
- [Apache Arrow](https://arrow.apache.org/)

## License

[MIT](LICENSE)

input.old_string:
# DuckDB SQL Playground

A browser-based SQL playground powered by [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm). Upload CSV files and query them with SQL — everything runs entirely in your browser with no server required.

**Live site:** https://cyyeh.github.io/duckdb-web/

## Features

- **In-browser SQL engine** — DuckDB compiled to WebAssembly, no server required
- **CSV file upload** — Drag-and-drop or click to import CSV files (up to 500 MB) with automatic schema detection
- **Sample dataset** — One-click load of the Titanic dataset to get started quickly
- **SQL query editor** — Write and execute queries with Ctrl+Enter
- **Results table** — View query results with column names, row counts, and execution time
- **Collapsible table sidebar** — Browse uploaded tables, inspect columns and types, toggle to expand your workspace

## Getting Started

```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

Open http://localhost:5173 to use the playground.

## Build

```bash
npm run build
npm run preview
```

## Deployment

The project includes a GitHub Actions workflow that automatically deploys to GitHub Pages on push to `main`.

## Tech Stack

- [React](https://react.dev/) 18
- [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
- [Vite](https://vite.dev/)
- [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm)
- [Apache Arrow](https://arrow.apache.org/)

## License

[MIT](LICENSE)
input.new_string:
# DuckDB SQL Playground

A browser-based SQL playground powered by [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm). Upload CSV files and query them with SQL — everything runs entirely in your browser with no server required.

**Live site:** https://cyyeh.github.io/duckdb-web/

## Features

### SQL Playground

- **In-browser SQL engine** — DuckDB compiled to WebAssembly, no server required
- **CSV file upload** — Drag-and-drop or click to import CSV files (up to 500 MB) with automatic schema detection
- **Sample dataset** — One-click load of the Titanic dataset to get started quickly
- **SQL query editor** — Write and execute queries with Ctrl+Enter
- **Results table** — Sortable columns, per-column filters, and global search across results
- **EXPLAIN support** — Markdown-rendered output for `EXPLAIN` and `EXPLAIN ANALYZE` queries
- **Collapsible table sidebar** — Browse uploaded tables, inspect columns and types, toggle to expand your workspace

### AI Agent

- **Natural language data analysis** — Ask questions about your data in plain English and get SQL queries + results
- **Powered by Claude** — Uses the Anthropic SDK to stream responses with tool use
- **Thinking steps** — Collapsible thinking block shows the agent's reasoning and intermediate SQL queries
- **Inline query results** — SQL results displayed inline within the conversation

## Getting Started

```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

Open http://localhost:5173 to use the playground.

### Environment Variables

Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and add your Anthropic API key:

```
CLAUDE_API_KEY=sk-ant-...
```

The API key is required for the AI agent feature. The SQL playground works without it.

## Build

```bash
npm run build
npm run preview
```

## Deployment

The project includes a GitHub Actions workflow that automatically deploys to GitHub Pages on push to `main`.

## Tech Stack

- [React](https://react.dev/) 18
- [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
- [Vite](https://vite.dev/)
- [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm)
- [Apache Arrow](https://arrow.apache.org/)
- [Anthropic SDK](https://github.com/anthropics/anthropic-sdk-typescript)

## License

[MIT](LICENSE)

content.content: The file /home/cyyeh/repos/ts-projects/duckdb-web/README.md has been updated successfully.

**Live site:** https://cyyeh.github.io/duckdb-web/

## Features

- **Sample dataset** — One-click load of the Titanic dataset to get started quickly

- **Results table** — Sortable columns, per-column filters, and global search across results

**Live site:** https://cyyeh.github.io/duckdb-web/

## Features

- **In-browser SQL engine** — DuckDB compiled to WebAssembly, no server required
- **CSV file upload** — Drag-and-drop or click to import CSV files (up to 500 MB) with automatic schema detection
- **Sample dataset** — One-click load of the Titanic dataset to get started quickly
- **SQL query editor** — Write and execute queries with Ctrl+Enter
- **Results table** — View query results with column names, row counts, and execution time
- **Collapsible table sidebar** — Browse uploaded tables, inspect columns and types, toggle to expand your workspace

## Getting Started

Open http://localhost:5173 to use the playground.

+- **Natural language data analysis** — Ask questions about your data in plain English and get SQL queries + results
+- **Powered by Claude** — Uses the Anthropic SDK to stream responses with tool use
+- **Thinking steps** — Collapsible thinking block shows the agent's reasoning and intermediate SQL queries
+- **Inline query results** — SQL results displayed inline within the conversation
Open http://localhost:5173 to use the playground.
+Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and add your Anthropic API key:
+The API key is required for the AI agent feature. The SQL playground works without it.

content.text:
Updated the README with:

- **Split features into two sections** — SQL Playground and AI Agent
- **Added missing features** — sortable columns, per-column filters, global search, EXPLAIN markdown view
- **Added AI agent features** — natural language analysis, Claude-powered streaming, collapsible thinking, inline results
- **Added environment variables section** — documents `.env` setup for the API key
- **Added Anthropic SDK** to the tech stack

content.content:
diff --git a/README.md b/README.md
index f836821..b7ae0ca 100644
--- a/README.md
+++ b/README.md
@@ -6,13 +6,23 @@ A browser-based SQL playground powered by [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckd
 
 ## Features
 
+### SQL Playground
+
 - **In-browser SQL engine** — DuckDB compiled to WebAssembly, no server required
 - **CSV file upload** — Drag-and-drop or click to import CSV files (up to 500 MB) with automatic schema detection
 - **Sample dataset** — One-click load of the Titanic dataset to get started quickly
 - **SQL query editor** — Write and execute queries with Ctrl+Enter
-- **Results table** — View query results with column names, row counts, and execution time
+- **Results table** — Sortable columns, per-column filters, and global search across results
+- **EXPLAIN support** — Markdown-rendered output for `EXPLAIN` and `EXPLAIN ANALYZE` queries
 - **Collapsible table sidebar** — Browse uploaded tables, inspect columns and types, toggle to expand your workspace
 
+### AI Agent
+
+- **Natural language data analysis** — Ask questions about your data in plain English and get SQL queries + results
+- **Powered by Claude** — Uses the Anthropic SDK to stream responses with tool use
+- **Thinking steps** — Collapsible thinking block shows the agent's reasoning and intermediate SQL queries
+- **Inline query results** — SQL results displayed inline within the conversation
+
 ## Getting Started
 
 ```bash
@@ -22,6 +32,16 @@ npm run dev
 
 Open http://localhost:5173 to use the playground.
 
+### Environment Variables
+
+Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and add your Anthropic API key:
+
+```
+CLAUDE_API_KEY=sk-ant-...
+```
+
+The API key is required for the AI agent feature. The SQL playground works without it.
+
 ## Build
 
 ```bash
@@ -40,6 +60,7 @@ The project includes a GitHub Actions workflow that automatically deploys to Git
 - [Vite](https://vite.dev/)
 - [DuckDB-WASM](https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb-wasm)
 - [Apache Arrow](https://arrow.apache.org/)
+- [Anthropic SDK](https://github.com/anthropics/anthropic-sdk-typescript)
 
 ## License
